title: Senior Javascript Engineer
description:
Summary

Botkeeper is looking for an experienced software engineer to join our team and help us build the world’s most advanced bookkeeping platform. You will help drive technical innovation by acquiring expertise in one or more of the domains in which botkeeper operates (accounts payable, accounts receivable, transaction categorization, etc..). A successful candidate will be a skilled collaborator and team player who is passionate about technology.

Must be willing to relocate to Charlotte, NC Our office is located at 615 S College St, Charlotte, NC 28202

Pay range: 100K to 150K based on experience

Responsibilities

  • Develop secure and scalable software to automate business processes Participate in the architecture, design, and development of large-scale, distributed software applications, tools, systems and services
  • Develop core technology and the refinement of existing code
  • Participate in the full software development life cycle, end-to-end, from scoping, planning, conception, design, implementation and testing, documentation, delivery, and maintenance, using best practice engineering standards
  • Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to other developers to maintain a quality codebase
  • Develop RESTful web services to support data-driven web applications

Skills

  • 5+ years of building RESTful APIs to support data-driven web applications in a service-oriented architecture
  • Must have advanced knowledge of JavaScript (Node.JS)
  • Extensive experience in designing, building, and consuming REST APIs
  • Experience with technology challenges trying to scale applications 10x
  • Strong knowledge of NoSQL databases (MongoDB)
  • Familiarity with Domain-Driven Design - Microservices and Bounded Contexts
  • Good communication and collaboration skills

title: Web Developer
description:
The Public Theater seeks a Web Developer to join its Digital Engagement team!

A subset of the Marketing and Communications department, the Digital Engagement team oversees the administration, development, and curation of The Public’s digital platforms, including our website (publictheater.org), our intranet, and our social media channels.

The Public is a cultural institution dedicated to upholding principles of diversity, equity, and inclusion. The ideal candidate must be willing to investigate how those principles apply in the context of marketing and communications.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Designs, implements and supports new web features for the public facing website and internal tools.
  • Develops and maintains front-end user interface designs using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and back-end functionality in C#/ASP.NET.
  • Integrates website with the Public Theater’s CRM, Tessitura, in collaboration with other Tessitura stakeholders.
  • Aligns development timelines with priorities of the larger organization.
  • Interacts with stakeholders across the organization, effectively communicating technical details to a non-technical audience.
  • Works with the IT team to maintain the website’s IT infrastructure.
  • Identifies opportunities to improve the web patron experience and recommends solutions.
  • Optimizes the Episerver CMS user experience through trainings, customizations, and documentation. REQUIREMENTS Candidates must have a working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript, familiarity with JavaScript libraries (ex. jQuery, Vue, React), and working knowledge of a backend programming language (ex. C#, Java, Ruby, Python). They should also have experience interfacing with a third party API, an eye for web design, and strong debugging skills.

We are looking for a self-starter with strong communication and project management skills. Must be able to approach their work with patience, diplomacy, and detail amidst a high-volume, fast-paced environment. Familiarity in the following platforms is ideal, but not required: Tessitura, Episerver, SQL, AWS, and/or Google Analytics.

The Public is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Applicants from populations underrepresented in the theater field are strongly encouraged to apply. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, familial status, sexual orientation, national origin, ability, age, or veteran status.

Please send cover letter, resume, and salary expectations to: jobs@publictheater.org
how_to_apply: Please send cover letter, resume, and salary expectations to: jobs@publictheater.org

title: Web Developer
description:
Web Developer Energiedirect.nl

essent - NL, Den Bosch

Deze baan biedt de ideale combinatie van web development, werken met de laatste tooling voor een topmerk in de energiebranche. Wil jij een onderdeel zijn van ons power team bij energiedirect.nl, in een omgeving waar je de vrijheid krijgt om een top prestatie te leveren voor onze klanten? Claim dan deze job!_

Als web developer bij energiedirect.nl werk je aan het continu verbeteren en optimaliseren van de stroom en gas ‘sales funnel’ en de loyality proposities op de eigen website. Ook houdt je je bezig met het op orde houden en verbeteren van de development tool en omgevingen. De focus ligt hierbij op het verhogen van het conversiepercentages in de funnel, het verbeteren van de performance en laadtijd van onze website en het verhogen van de time to market van onze development oplossingen en implementaties.

Jij maakt het mogelijk

Jij gebruikt de nieuwste technieken om het beste product aan de interne organisatie te leveren. Je denkt commercieel en bent in staat om te schakelen met collega’s met diverse vakspecialisten binnen een grote organisatie. Je weet een goede balans te vinden tussen professioneel en fun en je krijgt een kick van werken voor een mooi merk. Je staat open voor feedback en deelt graag je (development) ideeën binnen de teams.

Inspirerend, samenwerkingsgericht en met de nodige eigenaarschap pak jij als Web Developer je rol als het gaat om het:

  • Mee ontwikkelen van een future proof online platform
  • Invullen en aanscherpen van user stories samen met het development team
  • Opleveren van nieuwe front-end componenten (iteraties van 3 weken)
  • Fungeren als een belangrijke schakel in het ontwikkelen en verbeteren van de bestaande salesfunnels samen met een UX-designer en een e Performance Specialist
  • S.O.L.I.D. ontwikkelen en het leveren van code van hoge kwaliteit
  • Je stelt verbeteringen voor en creëert commitment voor jouw werk.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met een UX-designer, (online) marketeers en digital specialisten en professionals binnen andere afdelingen waaronder IT

Hier gebeurt het

Bij Essent! Een energiebedrijf dat elke dag werkt aan betaalbare energieoplossingen voor haar klanten en moederbedrijf is van de bekende merken Essent, energiedirect.nl en Powerhouse. In deze rol ga je specifiek werken voor het merk energiedirect.nl. energiedirect.nl is onze ‘value for money’ speler in de markt. Het is de beschermer van het Essent merk op prijs. 15 jaar geleden ontstaan vanuit het geloof dat energiezaken veel eenvoudiger kunnen; op prijs, op service en duidelijkheid. Met nuchterheid zijn we de markt gaan uitdagen. Zonder omwegen. Altijd voordelig, dat is de merkessentie. En dat levert voordeel op en gaat zelfs verder dan stroom en gas. Als voorvechters van vrijheid en gelijkheid trekken we ons niets aan van de gebaande paden. Waarom zou je op het fietspad blijven als het olifantenpaadje rechtdoor makkelijker en directer is? Deze overtuiging is doordrenkt in onze communicatie en stuurt al ons handelen.

Je versterkt het team C+ Activation (C+ staat voor Commodity+: levering stroom en gas). Samen zijn jullie verantwoordelijk voor een maximale klantwaarde over alle merken en kanalen. Jullie pakken de end-to-end regie op sales voor Essent, energiedirect.nl en Essent Zakelijk. Wij hebben de ambitie om meer dan 30% marktaandeel te realiseren en delen de ‘winner takes it all’ mindset. Jij rapporteert aan Manager Online Channel.

Jij hebt het

Er zit iets in jou, wat anderen aansteekt. Je neemt eigenaarschap, zoekt de samenwerking met collega’s en je laat je door ze inspireren. Als jij eenmaal iets in je hoofd hebt, ga jij door alle barrières heen. Tevens ben je leergierig, wil je je ontwikkelen en ben je een teamplayer. Wat je verder nog in huis hebt:

  • Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring
  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal
  • Je bent bekend met agile werken en hebt ervaring met het werken binnen een agile team
  • Je weet wat er speelt binnen ons vakgebied en weet het team te inspireren met de nieuwste feiten en technologieën
  • Je bent goed bekend met ASP.net MVC 4, HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, Javascript ES5 + ES6, SASS, Gulp, Web pack én Git Flow
  • Je hebt basiskennis van UX en SEO-technieken en hebt ervaring in het werken met Sitecore 8

Voor jou, van Essent

Je komt in een organisatie die je alle ruimte geeft om te experimenteren en waarin je nek uitsteken wordt beloond. In geld, kansen en persoonlijke groei. Wat je precies kunt verwachten (o.b.v. 40 uur per week):

  • Een baan bij een succesvol en leidend energiebedrijf dat altijd in beweging is. Stilstaan is geen optie! Durf jij op deze rijdende sneltrein te springen?
  • Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 3.113 en € 4.841, precies afgestemd op jouw niveau
  • Meer dan gemiddeld aantal vakantiedagen
  • Een andere manier van werken! Dankzij @nders werken kun je namelijk tijd- en plaats onafhankelijk werken, zo heb je zowel thuis als op kantoor alle faciliteiten om je werk goed te kunnen doen
  • Naast @nders werken doen we nog meer ‘anders’. Bij Essent streven we naar een hoge mate van effectiviteit en is de House-in-Order LEAN-methodiek in de hele organisatie geïntegreerd
  • Een inspirerende kantooromgeving op een toplocatie in Den Bosch! Met CS Den Bosch op slechts 850 meter, is reizen met het openbaar vervoer een aanrader. Al helemaal met de NS Business Card die je van ons ontvangt. Liever met eigen auto? Dan krijg je natuurlijk een kilometervergoeding

En last but not least: een breed scala aan ontwikkel- en doorgroeimogelijkheden. Want Essent staat niet stil, maar jij ook niet!

Ben jij onze nieuwe Web Developer energiedirect.nl? Stel je aan ons voor en reageer via deze link: Klik hier om te solliciteren!

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The Senior Web Software Engineer will be responsible for the analysis, design, development, testing, documenting and support of information systems.

  1. Designs and delivers web applications with emphasis on security and performance
  2. Able to develop complex modules with little to no supervision.
  3. Conducts system analysis and development, with limited support, to keep systems current with changing technologies
  4. Diagnoses current applications and designs solutions to problematic programming
  5. Develops, tests, and reviews code to ensure accurate and efficient solutions; provides assistance to junior developers
  6. Analyzes system specifications and translates system requirements to task specifications for junior developers
  7. Responds promptly and professionally to defect reports
  8. Reviews and repairs legacy code
  9. Researches and utilizes tools that assist with development, security, and performance
  10. Be the subject matter expert for software solutions as they relate to healthcare
  11. Maintains positive relations with all peers, stakeholders, and clients
  12. BA/BS in related field (computer science, information systems, etc.) or equivalent experience
  13. Excellent knowledge of OOP principles and design patterns
  14. 7+ years of formal .NET web application development in C#, Visual Studio, and TFS

  19. Experience resolving production and infrastructure issues

  21. Experience and ability to lead, teach, and instruct teams

title: Senior developer(.NET+JS)
description:
Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as a developer
  • Deep knowledge of .NET, C#, JavaScript
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • The candidate needs to be a team player with a positive attitude
  • Level of English Intermediate+

As plus

  • ASP.NET
  • Web API
  • AngularJS
  • HTML5, CSS3
  • SQL
  • WPF/WCF/WWF
  • Experience in building responsive applications
  • Higher technical education
  • Experience with Agile frameworks

We offer:

  • Participate in the development of an enterprise software product, Matrix42 Workspace Management, utilizing cutting-edge technologies and methodology, like SPA, AngularJS
  • Possibility to influence technical decisions, requirements, development process.
  • Highly Competitive compensation (depends on the candidate level)
  • Work in a strong team to deliver business-oriented solutions that meet requirements and expectations.
  • Long-term employment
  • Attractive benefits package
  • paid sick leave
  • vacations (25 working days)
  • Free English courses
  • Medical Insurance
  • Office in downtown Kiev
  • Professional training which meets company needs
  • Free coffee, tea, juice, snacks
  • Regular company events locally and abroad
  • Casual, positive and open work environment

About:

Management

Matrix42 Workspace Management is a Business Process Platform that helps IT Department of any company to become a full blown Service Provider. The latest and greatest IT and Non-IT Business Processes are supported and certified, like Incident-, Problem-, Change-, Configuration-, Service Level Management, SAM or any other Service Management Process you wish for. We provide the means for our customers to shape the Solution according to their business needs without worrying about update issues and with any need of development skills - it just works! With drag&drop Workflows, an intuitive Layout Designer and a tool to ensure that the data is flowing seamlessly from any data source. No matter if your data is on-premise, in the cloud, a Microsoft SQL Server Database or a fancy REST API, you can connect and interact with it with a technology called SolutionBuilder.

PLATFORM - The Solution Builder

Matrix42 SolutionBuilder is the core of all our business processes. It's a modern drag&drop application builder based on Microsoft ASP.NET WebAPI with a Microsoft SQL Server on the backend and AngularJS with Angular Material on the frontend. Our invention let you create any UX you seek for as well as any datapersistance you want, just by configuration through with a nice UserExperience. We develop SolutionBuilder so our customers don't have to acquire any development skills, but let their creativity flow and create awesome apps to ensure that their business is reacting as fast to business changes, as we react on technilogy changes - always be on the latest and greatest. The Matrix42 Workflow Studio, based on Microsoft's latest Workflow Foundation with a Visual Studio rehosted designer, enables our customers to model their Business Logic with straight forward Workflows and our many Workflow Activities.

PROCESS - Lean & Agile

We living and breathing SCRUM, Lean and Agile. Self motivation and autonomous working in our one week sprints is key to success for us. "Innovate like a startup, deliver like an enterprise" is our CTO's key quote. Our modern office provides you startup flavor with the security of a strong software vendor that has a strong manifest for over 20 years in the industry.

Work hard - Play hard!

We're working on Visual Studio Team Services on git repositories. Our weekly iterations and our continuous integration approach ensures cloud-like deployment to our customers, even though it is an enterprise solution that is by 90% installed on-premise.

Apply now via the application form for Matrix42 and help us to create the game changing enterprise software solutions that will roll up the market!

title: Entrepreneurial Developer
description:
Seeking Entrepreneurial Developer We need an ambitious and hands-on developer to lead our software team, building mobile and Web apps. You will be responsible for turning our current MVP app into a leading product with much wider distribution. Next steps include improving the UX, adding security layers, and adding automated testing and continuous integration. You will join our distributed team, and get a full salary plus early stage startup options.

KEY SKILLS Java ReactNative MYSQL Javascript AWS Git QUALIFICATIONS Talented programmer with a proven ability to write Web and mobile apps Can work remotely and independently Likes working with early stage startups Can grow to handle architecture and team building Fluent in written and verbal English Desire to integrate behavioral change science into digital health

Salary and equity with a cliff/vesting schedule.

AdviceCoach/AC Health is an app provider that gives healthcare providers -- initially physical therapists -- a much more effective way to communicate personalized medical instructions to their patients. We received a Net Promoter Score of 91 from hundreds of our beta users.

During the trial we will work together on some of our outstanding tasks. After that we will seek a long term, full-time commitment

title: SENIOR JAVA ENGINEER
description:
As Senior Java Engineer, you will play a key role in the technical infrastructure team of our Corporate Systems department. You will be part of a passionate and experienced agile engineering team responsible for some of the most critical systems behind InnoGames’ sustainable success.

Your mission:

You will be part of a diverse engineering team developing our Marketing platforms as well as our player account management system You will work in an agile environment with several cross-functional Kanban teams consisting of Backend, Frontend and Quality Assistance Engineers You will work closely together with our game teams to shape and design our centralised and highly available user management system As part of our Corporate Systems department, you will help to maintain and further develop our high-performance culture in a cheerful and cooperative work environment – where achievements are recognised, regular knowledge sharing is encouraged, and fun is our foundation

Your profile:

You have completed a Computer Sciences, Business Information Systems degree or have relevant experience You take on a high level of responsibility and are able to make good decisions based on an excellent understanding of business requirements You know the advantages and disadvantages of various architectures and have experience implementing them You have proven experience with relational databases, preferably with high availability MySQL environments You have excellent communication skills and are willing to embrace our company culture and values Your presentation skills are superb, and you like to give talks at one of our various internal knowledge sharing events You have excellent English language skills

What we offer to all employees:

You’ll work in a multicultural agile team – enabling you and your team to form and actively optimise work processes We actively support personal development, pay for any necessary textbooks as well as sending you to developer conferences You can set up your workspace as you wish: Mac, Linux or Windows, two or more monitors, a free choice of IDE as well as other software We provide you with a mobile device (e.g. iPhone or iPad) for private use You can take creative breaks: play table tennis with your team, play on our arcade machines, work out in our gym or simply go to our roof terrace to get some fresh air We contribute to your public transport ticket and subsidise contributions to the company pension plan We offer free drinks and fresh fruit to contribute to your health and wellbeing We have regular team events (e.g. curling, cooking, paintball), barbecue together on our roof terrace and a company-organised after work get together every Thursday We offer trust-based working times in a modern office in the centre of Hamburg Our company language is English, and we support all our employees and their partners with optional German lessons We help you relocate to Hamburg We have fun at work!

Excited to start your journey with InnoGames and join our dynamic team as a Senior Java Engineer? We look forward to receiving your application as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible start date through our online application form. Maximilian Kaeding would be happy to answer any questions you may have.

InnoGames is Germany’s leading developer and publisher of mobile and online games. The company based in Hamburg is best known for Forge of Empires, Elvenar and Tribal Wars. InnoGames’ first mobile title Warlords of Aternum is a fantasy turn-based strategy game. InnoGames’ complete portfolio encompasses seven live games and several mobile titles in production.

Born as a hobby, InnoGames today has a team of 400 employees from more than 30 nations who share the passion of creating unique games that players across the globe enjoy for years. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.

title: Javascript frontend developer
description:
De functie.

Als allround Javascript programmeur ben je samen met Ivo, Bardt en Bas, Evert, Armand en Fatih bezig met het constant draaiend houden en upgraden van ons leerplatform. Jij leest en interpreteert het design prototype en zorgt dat dit design vertaald wordt naar een technisch prototype. Hierna produceer je JS componenten op basis van het technisch prototype en zorg je voor aansluiting op de API’s. Tenslotte documenteer je de nieuwe componenten.

Jij.

Jij werkt in een agile werkomgeving waarin je in 2-weekse cycli in overleg toegewezen deliverables oplevert. Er wordt een zekere mate van zelfredzaamheid verwacht waarin jij optimaal kan werken aan jouw taken en verantwoordelijkheden.

Gedurende deze cyclus houden we elkaar op de hoogte van onze vorderingen en eventuele problemen. In een review sessie worden alle deliverables besproken en wordt de nieuwe planning bepaald.

Wat je sowieso kunt.

  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal;
  • Je hebt Vanilla JS volledig onder de knie (minimaal drie jaar werkervaring);
  • Kennis van Object Oriented Programming;
  • Communicatief vaardig.

Dit zijn pluspunten.

  • Gedegen kennis van CSS3; • Sass ervaring is een dikke pre;
  • Ervaring in het vertalen van functioneel ontwerp in technische specificaties;
  • Kennis en ervaring met Visual Studio.

Wij.

Wat we bieden.

  • Een fulltime functie (40 uur) met goede arbeidsvoorwaarden bij een dynamisch internationaal bedrijf;
  • Prima salaris en overige arbeidsvoorwaarden (inclusief winstdeling en pensioenregeling);
  • Laptop van de zaak;
  • Onbeperkt toegang tot onze interne trainingsbibliotheek;
  • Een schitterend kantoor in hartje Eindhoven, inclusief gameroom;
  • Bruisende teams met gedreven medewerkers.

Wie we zijn.

Met een groot aantal grote klanten en een bereik van meer dan een miljoen cursisten is GoodHabitz uitgegroeid tot toonaangevende aanbieder van online trainingen in Nederland. Inmiddels krijgen we met onze visie op online leren ook in de rest van Europa voet aan de grond: we zijn actief in zes landen met hoofdkantoren in Eindhoven, Londen, Parijs, Madrid, Frankfurt en Antwerpen.

Ons doel is om onze cursisten productiever, positiever en gelukkiger te maken met behulp van onze trainingen, zowel op de werkvloer als in hun privéleven. Daarom hebben alle werknemers van onze klanten toegang tot ons volledige, steeds uitbreidende trainingsaanbod. Onderwerpen variëren van management en persoonlijke effectiviteit tot MS Office en communicatie.

Reageren.

Heb je interesse? We maken graag kennis met je! Reageer via de "Solliciteer" button en vul het sollicitatieformulier in. Wij zullen zo snel mogelijk iets van onszelf laten horen.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Search Relevance Engineer
description:
What's next in music happens on SoundCloud first. As the world’s largest open audio platform, SoundCloud is powered by a connected community of creators, listeners and curators who share, discover and influence what’s new, now and next in music and audio.

We are looking for an experienced Relevance Engineer to join our team in Berlin. As a relevance engineer on search, you will contribute to build and maintain systems that empower our users to actively and easily discover SoundCloud’s huge and unique catalog. You will contribute to increase the search experience with respect to ranking, user assistance and user interface in order to enable listeners to find the most relevant and engaging content. We want people that come equipped with an open mind, creativity and a get-it-done attitude.

As engineers at SoundCloud, our work often involves large-scale distributed systems, parallel computing, and data science. We actively improve our tools and processes to support collaboration and productivity. We cultivate an environment where we can all learn and grow. For more, read about engineering at SoundCloud.

Who you are

  • Industry experience working on search relevance and large scale data processing.
  • In-depth understanding of search relevance ranking.
  • Experienced in languages such as Scala, Java, Go or Python.
  • Experienced with technologies, such as Elasticsearch, Kafka and data processing pipelines.
  • Passionate about working with large amount of data to develop and evaluate data-driven products, striking a healthy balance between principled and pragmatic approaches to solve consumer use cases.
  • Good communication skills with both technical and non-technical people (e.g. designers and product managers)
  • Values teamwork, shares gained knowledge with teammates and brainstorm new ideas  If this describes you, we'd love to chat. 

Diversity at SoundCloud:

SoundCloud is for everyone. Diversity and open expression are fundamental to our organization; they help us build a social platform and global community where anyone can create, discover, and share sounds. We acknowledge the challenges in our industry, and strive to develop an inclusive culture where everyone can contribute.

  • We’re international! We operate in the US, Berlin and London and all of our communication is in English. 

  • We have a flexible, friendly and inclusive office environment in Mitte 

  • Our environment is a learning one, with specific focus on development, including a professional development allowance and a possibility to use 20% of your time for a personal project.

  • You can contribute to our Engineering Blog post. 

  • Not located in Berlin? No worries, we offer extensive relocation support including allowances, one way flights, temporary accommodation and, by partnering with Expath, on the ground support on arrival.

  • Interested in a gym membership, photography course or book? We have a Creativity and wellness benefit!

  • We offer free German courses in office at beginning, intermediate and advanced. 

  • Lunch twice a week, plus countless snacks and goodies!
how_to_apply:
Apply via this link: https://jobs.soundcloud.com/job?gh_jid=4364072002

or email your CV to anya.voronova@soundcloud.com

title: YouVersion Software Engineer
description:
The YouVersion Software Engineer will help develop and build software and services that lead to increased engagement and growth through the Bible App across the globe.

You’ve got skills. You’re motivated. You’ve got a passion to see people come to know Christ. All you’ve been missing is a place to put all of it together. The YouVersion Team could be that place. God brings people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences here, but He does it because we all have one thing in common: we won’t stop until every person on this Earth knows the love of Jesus. Ministry might not have been the first stop on your road map, but if you’ve been praying to put your skills to work alongside a team of Kingdom-minded, sold-out, on-fire believers, we’ve got good news. You’re on the right path.

The YouVersion team is looking for a unique individual to serve as a Software Engineer. With more than 238 million installs of the Bible App and 13 million installs of the Bible App for Kids, the YouVersion team continues to grow and evolve in an effort to appropriately steward the opportunities brought our way.

If you are excited about using technology to help people become fully devoted followers of Christ, keep reading for details.

The Basics

  • Great at solving large, complicated, and brain-melting technology problems
  • Skilled in managing time, details, and deadlines
  • Willing to do whatever it takes to help your team succeed
  • Consistently seek to learn and grow personally and professionally
  • Work in warp speed and enjoy variety Skilled in Python, Java, C++ or other general-purpose programming languages
  • Proficient in Object-Relational Database Management Systems, such as Postgres
  • Have at least five years of experience working on an agile software team

The Works

  • Act as key engineer on our team – planning, building, and delivering highly scalable software and services to meet the demand of our users
  • Engage as an active contributor within our agile development process
  • Collaborate with design, platform, and product teams to ensure the continuous delivery of high quality and reliable software
  • Take ownership of projects and oversee them with minimal direction
  • Manage schedules and duties to efficiently meet the needs of the organization in the pursuit of helping others become fully devoted followers of Christ

The Cherry on Top

  • You can translate English into Binary
  • Brewing your morning coffee requires at least seven different apparatuses, none of which are a coffeemaker
  • Your root@localhost password is the chemical formula for caffeine

This position is located at the Life.Church Central Offices in Edmond, OK

Apply today at http://bit.ly/YouVersionSoftwareEngineer.

title: YouVersion Mobile Engineer - Android
description:
The YouVersion Mobile Engineer will help people around the world engage with God’s Word by developing, refining, and growing the YouVersion Bible App mobile experience on Android devices.

God has placed you on the earth for a reason, at this crucial moment in time. He’s given you a purpose. With the smartest tech at our fingertips and more distractions vying for our attention than ever before, the need for the Bible has never been greater. If you’re looking for a place you can combine the skills God has given you with your passion to see people engage with His Word in new ways—no matter where they are or what languages they speak—the YouVersion Team is the place to start. Come change the world with us!

We’re looking for a unique individual with a passion for Android application development to serve as a Mobile App Engineer. With more than a quarter of a billion installs of the Bible App and 16 million installs of the Bible App for Kids, the YouVersion team continues to grow and evolve in an effort to appropriately steward the opportunities brought our way. Are you excited about building awesome mobile apps for a variety of tablets and smartphone` devices and interested in exploring the unique challenges of large-scale mobile apps? Then keep reading!

You'll be:

  • Contributing to all aspects of development on our mobile engineering team helping to drive enhancements to our Android application
  • Engaging as an active member within our agile development process
  • Collaborating with our various platform teams to ensure features and software design patterns are consistent
  • Testing, debugging, and maintaining software throughout the product lifecycle

You'll fit right in if you are:

  • Passionate about the mission of YouVersion: Helping people engage with the Bible
  • Great at solving large, complicated, and difficult technology problems

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Meet GetUpside

GetUpside helps businesses grow and people save by driving customers to nearby businesses with personalized cash back offers. We’re driving new customers to local businesses (more than 5,000 businesses across 13 states have made $10+ million in profit through GetUpside). We’re putting cash back in consumers’ pockets (more than $7 million cash back earned).

In the end, we want to help local businesses get what they need (customers) and consumers get what they need (gas, groceries, you name it) for less. GetUpside is growing rapidly, with 17x growth in transaction volume in 2018 and we’re driving hundreds of millions of dollars of commerce a year.

We're a DC-based startup founded in 2016 and made up of a great collection of people from companies like Google, Opower, Washington Post, MasterCard, Capital One, and LivingSocial. We recently closed our second round of funding and are well-funded by a great group of investors who care about our company, our mission, and our team’s success.

Meet GetUpside Engineering

The engineering team at GetUpside is a close-knit group of talented, fast-learning individuals that believes in our mission to help communities thrive. We believe in a data-driven approach to decision-making and a supportive culture that emphasizes learning from our mistakes. We debate and deliberate on the best ideas to improve our tech stack, and strive for an inclusive atmosphere that champions the psychological wellness of all of our teammates.

Our technology stack

  • AWS to run our microservices in a message-oriented-architecture
  • Java 8 / Dropwizard / 12-factor apps
  • Python 3 / Serverless AWS Lambdas
  • MySQL & DynamoDB
  • S3 & Athena
  • Jenkins / Github / Terraform

What will you do?

  • You will work in a team of 2-3 engineers and a product manager on our larger projects and sometimes individually on smaller, bite-sized improvements.
  • You will deliver new product features in support of our mobile apps for users and web dashboards for merchants and improve our existing products’ ability to scale with increased user and merchant demand.
  • You will build Java REST services to act in concert with our AWS-based message-oriented architecture and also build Python “glue” logic, deployed on AWS Lambda using the Serverless framework.
  • You will identify, design, lead and/or contribute to anything and everything that needs to get done.

What do you bring?

  • You have previous experience working on back-end jobs and services in Java
  • You have strong analytical, organizational, and prioritization skills.
  • You demonstrate ability to bring code from whiteboard scribbles to running in production.
  • You are passionate about working in a dynamic and growing startup environment with a tight-knit, supportive engineering team that strives to make work interesting, challenging and fun.
  • You have a constant desire for learning and self-improvement.

We're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
how_to_apply: Please apply directly via this job link: https://www.getupside.com/careers/?gh_jid=4486367002

title: YouVersion Full-Stack Software Engineer
description:
The Full-Stack Software Engineer will be responsible for engineering web-based solutions that directly support features built by YouVersion’s Product Engineering Teams.

God has placed you on the earth for a reason, at this crucial moment in time. He’s given you a purpose. With the smartest tech at our fingertips and more distractions vying for our attention than ever before, the need for the Bible has never been greater. If you’re looking for a place you can combine the skills God has given you with your passion to see people engage with His Word in new ways—no matter where they are or what languages they speak—the YouVersion Team is the place to start.

With over 6,000 spoken languages and the majority of the world on 3G or slower mobile connections, the YouVersion Team is inventing technical solutions that create a first-class Bible experience for every person, regardless of language or location. We’re seeking a Full-Stack Engineer who will be responsible for engineering web-based solutions that directly support features built by YouVersion’s Product Engineering Teams. This includes (but is not limited to) internal content management systems, new feature development, and rapid prototyping. You’ll work alongside world-class programmers to solve complex problems as you strive to make the Bible accessible in every language, everywhere on earth, on systems that are used by millions every day.

If your passion for innovation is only surpassed by your desire to see people changed through the power of God’s Word, keep reading!

  • Calm and efficient under pressure and able to learn new things quickly
  • Someone who knows when a 301 is better than a 404
  • Good at translating the big picture into bite-size requirements

You will be:

  • Writing code, fixing bugs, and changing the world
  • Working with a team to build new features for Bible.com, the YouVersion Bible App, and new experiences and platforms

You know well:

  • Modern Javascript Syntax and Tools (ES6+,Babel, Webpack, etc.)

  • A Node.js Web server (Express,Fastify,or something similar)

It would rock if you:

  • Believe that accessibility, responsiveness, and site speed are the second holiest trinity
  • Think it’s normal to write a SQL query, build a React Component, and squash a bug before lunch
  • Enjoy a continuous integration workflow with zero-downtime deploys

This position will be located at the Life.Church Central Offices in Edmond, OK.

Apply at http://bit.ly/YouVersionFullStackEngineer.

title: Software Developer
description:
Who we are

The American Physical Society (APS) is a nonprofit membership organization working to advance and diffuse the knowledge of physics through its outstanding research journals, scientific meetings, and education, outreach, advocacy, and international activities. The American Physical Society, a leading publisher of scientific journals, based in Suffolk County, LI, is seeking a front end developer. This is an exciting opportunity to apply your strong front end development and UX skills to build applications used in all aspects of scientific publishing.

We’re a group who happily share knowledge and value other ideas, while working in a bright, modern office with a friendly atmosphere and flat hierarchies. We will challenge you with interesting work while providing you with a collaborative culture in a fast paced environment. Our staff is encouraged to attend industry conferences and we are constantly playing with new tools and use all the latest and greatest technologies, affording you the capability to impact all aspects of your projects.

You must have excellent English communication skills, be a problem solver and a team player, and be results oriented. Other incentives for working at APS are great pay, great benefits, generous 403(b), fun company events, commuter benefits, and 3 weeks paid vacation.

If possible, when applying, please provide code samples and URL's of previous applications you've developed. Candidates who provide links to their GitHub profiles or personal websites with technical articles and/or code samples will receive priority.

Required Skills

  • Expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and associated web standards
  • Experience writing modern Javascript (ES6/ES2015, ES2017, Typescript, etc).
  • Experience with front-end frameworks such as React or Vue.js
  • Experience with modern front-end tooling (Babel, webpack, gulp, parcel, etc.)

  • Knowledge of UI/UX design concepts, pattern libraries, style guides, etc.
  • Basic command line proficiency (Linux and/or Mac OS X preferred)

Desired Skills

The American Physical Society strives to:

  • Be the leading voice for physics and an authoritative source of physics information for the advancement of physics and the benefit of humanity.
  • Provide effective programs in support of the physics community and the conduct of physics.
  • Collaborate with national scientific societies for the advancement of science, science education and the science community.
  • Cooperate with international physics societies to promote physics, to support physicists worldwide and to foster international collaboration.

The American Physical Society is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, disability or veteran status.

We welcome you to apply today!

title: Haskell Engineer at LeapYear - Core Platform
description:
What we do

LeapYear's secure machine learning platform is deployed by some of the largest enterprises in the world across finance, healthcare, and technology.

Our technology ensures differential privacy, a widely recognized standard of data privacy that enables all data - including sensitive information - to be utilized for analytics, while providing mathematically proven privacy protection.

The LeapYear system is composed of a core set of components that allow private machine learning on data sets that can scale to petabytes. The system includes private algorithms for relational operations, statistical methods and machine learning. A data scientist accesses private data using a Python API. Administration is provided via a web-based GUI or an API.

LeapYear's platform team builds the services that allow our product to integrate with complex enterprise environments and operate effectively on our customers’ most sensitive data.

The platform includes services for authentication, access control, logging, auditing and support for integration of data from a variety of data sources including SQL/NoSQL Databases, HDFS and S3. Queries are processed using Spark to support to enable fast, distributed processing of massive data sets. The services are primarily written in Haskell, with Python, Scala, and Java used as additional supporting languages.

We are looking for platform engineers that have a track record of developing enterprise-ready features for technical end users, including enterprise integrations, rigorous security, flexible deployment, and support for diverse data sources.

Recent technical challenges we've been working on

  • Developing a Spark-based query engine with strong typechecking.
  • Achieving terabyte and petabyte scale on Spark.
  • Refactoring our persistence layer.
  • Using Haskell to implement enterprise-ready subsystems for authentication, permissioning, job management, and logging.
  • Extending the platform to support automated daily data updates.

For details on the specific responsibilities and requirements of this role, please see below.

Responsibilities

  • Develop greenfield systems and scale existing services to support internet-scale deployments.
  • Own the full software development lifecycle - problem definition, design, development, testing, demoing, and supporting production use of the features you own.
  • Partner with product management to define problems and identify iterative solutions
  • Balance immediate business objectives against long-term architectural vision
  • Contribute to an engineering-wide culture of code quality and shared responsibility for testing

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional experience writing production code
  • Acquainted with and interested in functional programming (Haskell, OCaml, Clojure, Erlang, Scala)
  • Track record of delivering high-quality product features on schedule

Preferred

  • Experience developing for on-premise enterprise deployments
  • Professional experience with functional programming
  • Prior experience developing production-level Spark applications or machine learning platforms
  • Experience with ODBC/JDBC databases, AWS, CircleCI
  • Lifelong learners and mentors

A Few of the Perks

  • Culture of teaching and learning
  • Competitive compensation package of salary and equity
  • Catered lunch every day
  • Company outings
  • Build your ideal work station
  • Generous health insurance plan
  • Relocation support and visa sponsorship

title: Software Engineer- Frontend
description:
Have you been writing beautiful web UIs for as long as you can remember? Are you excited about the rapid evolution of browser apps? Do typical shallow web opportunities out there leave you wanting for more?

We’re on a mission to bring sanity to Dev & Ops, and we need you to engineer engaging and usable UIs to effortlessly explore large amounts of data, and to help our users understand their infrastructure through interactive visualizations.

What you will do

  • Transform large and complex datasets to beautiful visualizations
  • Implement compelling, usable UIs; contribute to their design; and engineer them with React and Redux
  • Join a tightly knit team solving hard problems the right way
  • Improve performance and address scalability limits
  • Own meaningful parts of our service, have an impact, grow with the company

What we're looking for

  • You have been designing and engineering UIs for several years
  • You’re a master of Javascript, HTML, and CSS and you’re aware of the latest trends with frontend technologies
  • You know how to use design patterns to create simple and reusable components for complex UIs
  • You are familiar with data structures and algorithms, profiling and optimization
  • Your work or portfolio is visible online
  • You value code simplicity, performance and details
  • You want to work in a fast, high growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers

Bonus points

  • You fell in love with D3 (we did)
  • You’ve worked on a large application using React, Angular, Backbone, Ember, Flux, or Redux
  • You write your Javascript in ES6 and Babel
  • You enjoy writing Python, Ruby, C++, Rust or Go

title: Senior Application Developer
description:
Opportunity

Abt Associates seeks a qualified Senior Application Developer to support the Data Science and Survey and Enabling Technologies Division. We are looking for experienced candidates with expertise of one or more of the following: client and server side web programming in PHP, JavaScript frameworks like Angular/Node/React/Vue, backend databases MySQL along with a good understanding of web design and usability. Experience in configuring and using cloud environments such as AWS and technologies like Lambda. The senior developer will work closely with internal and external clients and serve as both a consultant and solutions provider. The senior developer will help architect and define solutions to meet the business needs. The senior developer will oversee testing, quality assurance and post rollout troubleshooting and enhancements. Candidate should demonstrate a willingness to seek novel solutions to technology and business problems and the flexibility to acquire the necessary skills for implementation.

Key Roles and Responsibilities

  • Create technical application designs by documenting process flows; mapping functional requirements to technical requirements; creating database diagrams; and creating application prototypes, where applicable
  • Estimate the level of effort required to complete technical work. Plan technical work so that it may be completed on schedule and within budget
  • Develop complex applications using the appropriate approach and technology, with focus on long-term support implications
  • Coordinate quality control activities by developing test plans, executing tests, and facilitating transition to end-users for testing and signoff
  • Builds web applications using predefined template structures to respond to client needs
  • Participates in client needs assessments, develops strategy and information architecture, including sitemaps and wireframes
  • Supports clients’ technical issues with web applications
  • Acts as liaison with internal partners and individual users to ensure positive web experience
  • May serve as project leader and/or supervise other technical staff on project teams, as required
  • Ensures that all documents meet established content standards
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

Preferred Skills / Prerequisites

  • Web and application development using PHP
  • Experience in writing JavaScript targeting the Node runtime for AWS Lambda or equivalent
  • JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks such as Angular/Node/React/Vue
  • HTML5 / CSS
  • Version control repositories like Bitbucket
  • Task management in software development tools like Jira and Confluence
  • A desire to write re-usable, readable code using the most up to date industry standards
  • Strong communication skills, particularly in translating perceived needs into technical requirements
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently in a fast paced, deadline driven environment

Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS with (6-8) years of experience OR the equivalent combination of education and experience

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Sertifi offers an Agreement Platform built for businesses who need a more efficient and secure way to manage the full contract process. We simplify how businesses send and collect agreements and payments by bringing it all into one secure platform. Sertifi automates business processes, saves you time from performing repetitive tasks, enhances security and PCI-compliance, and provides customers an easy and convenient way to do business with your company. Thousands of businesses around the world use Sertifi to streamline their contracts and payment processes, recognize revenue faster, and increase job efficiency.

We are looking for a talented and highly motivated Full Stack Developer to help launch new features and expand capabilities of our electronic signature and payment application. The web application is written in ASP.NET, with client-side Angular/Typescript, Node.JS, JavaScript, and jQuery. The back-end database is SQL Server with web services used to expose a rich and simple to use API.

Our ideal candidate is a self-starter who is capable of building advanced ASP.NET applications as part of a team. You must be able to fully understand the ins and outs of ASP.NET, how it works, or be able to pick up a book or online tutorial and teach yourself when something unknown comes your way. You’ll have the opportunity to immediately contribute and see results of your work in use by millions of users across the globe. This position reports to our Engineering Manager in our downtown Chicago office.

Challenges You’ll Tackle:

  • Take ownership of, architect, build and scale business critical services

  • Develop a deep understanding of the relevant business areas and various components in the stack

  • Develop integration strategies

 

What You’ll Need to Succeed:

  • 5+ years of experience working on large scale web applications

  • Expert in .NET based technologies and ecosystem - .NET Framework through 4.5, WebAPI, ASP.NET MVC

  • For the Front End we’re looking for expert level knowledge of Angular/Typescript and Node.JS

  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

  • Web service consumption and design experience (REST or SOAP)

  • Solid competencies in data structures, design patterns, algorithms

  • Strong web application design and architectural skills

  • Understanding of data layer concerns and working knowledge of SQL

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

 

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with mercurial or git

  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure and Salesforce

  • Experience with SSO flows and SAML

  • Experience with eCommerce payments or PDF parsing and manipulation

  • Experience with message bus/distributed systems

What’s in it for you: You will work in a collaborative office environment that welcomes new ideas and allows you to make an immediate impact on the team. You can also expect to have dedicated heads down time to code along with time set aside each month to work on Innovation ideas. Additionally, we offer great benefits such as: competitive salary, medical/dental/vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance, 401k with company match, paid parental leave, life insurance, pre-tax Transit Benefit Program, casual work environment, weekly team lunches, company outings, and a convenient River North location close to public transit.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Job Description

An exciting opportunity to join a dynamic, innovative team, working on cutting edge technology. Bring your technical engineering expertise and we’ll give you every opportunity to enhance and grow your professional experience.

Where you fit

This is a chance to join one of our new innovation hubs at Shell, bringing your talent and excellent communication skills to a role as DevOps Engineer.

At Shell’s Agile Hub, we’re taking pride in doing things differently – by taking a unique approach of balancing human-centred and digital design with an agile technology capability to tackle complex problems in original ways.

Joining a proactive team of engineers, and with a huge variety of potential projects to grow across the business, you’ll be challenged to think innovatively, with many different areas to investigate.

What’s the role?

As DevOps Engineer, you’ll thrive on working smart, as you build environments for Agile projects, always on the lookout for opportunities and remaining continually curious as to why things happen.

Your responsibilities will be wide-ranging, from responding to and fixing issues of all sizes and prevent them from happening again, to working with subject matter experts to learn new skills and integrate them into team learnings. Other duties will include:

Developing alerts to improve our monitoring. Co-ordinating incidents, including alerts to other engineering teams. Writing and refining troubleshooting guides and documentation.

Requirements

What we need from you

We’re keen to hear from men and women with DevOps Engineering experience, relevant expertise as a developer, a strong background in Linux as well as strong Kubernetes experience. Plus, we’d also hope to see as many of the following on your CV:

  • Experience of Agile and/or DAD (Scrum & Kanban), plus experience using Docker and programming in Hashicorp Terraform, Bash, Python and Ansible.
  • Strong experience of Kubernetes in building environments from scratch, preferably over PaaS. Exposure to Kops, Kubespray and Kubeadm is also advantageous
  • An understanding of Microservice based Architecture.
  • An ability to implement infrastructure as code.
  • A strong understanding of web server application design.
  • An understanding of application security and information security controls.
  • Data Science platform experience, plus monitoring and logging platforms, will be an advantage.
  • Knowledge of configuration management tools.
  • Experience in Javascript development and mobile app development is also desirable.

An innovative place to work

There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.

Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.

An inclusive place to work

To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…

  • We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.
  • We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
  • We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
  • We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.

A rewarding place to work

Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.

We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

Interested?

Please apply via the Link!

Company Description

Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then we have grown into a leading innovative oil and gas company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation, and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.

Disclaimer

Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.

Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world.

The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand.

Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
Senior Full Stack Engineer

AJ Madison is looking for a Senior / Lead Full Stack Engineer who’s a true technophile, an independent thinker, and a strong team player to lead our web engineering team.

This is a critical leadership position.

  • Designing and developing systems and applications, making specific determinations about system performance.
  • Design and develop fault-tolerant scalable systems.
  • Designing and developing next-gen architecture (web, mobile etc.).

AJ Madison prides itself on its innovative and knowledgeable staff. Our team members are not just sales associates; they are passionate chefs, laundry enthusiasts, and design aficionados. Our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of each of our customers. Through the usage of the latest technology, product knowledge and passion for the industry, we at AJ Madison have been successful at providing the best experience possible for each of customers. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on our mission.

What You’ll Do

  • Work on a cross-functional team of other engineers (frontend, backend, and full stack), a Product Manager and a Designer.
  • Work on our production application – a PHP and MySql app with React/Redux on the frontend.
  • Ship new experiences to our customers via A/B tests.
  • Deploy to code to production multiple times a day.
  • Help us figure out engineering solutions that give 80% of the benefit with 20% of the work.
  • Write automated functional and unit tests.

You..

  • Have at least 7+ years of full stack experience. Minimum 3 years' experience developing rich, large-scale web applications (prerebaly ecommerce applications).
  • Have seen what works well and what doesn’t work well in frontend and backend codebases.
  • Are an expert in one server language, (preferably PHP), Javascript and one frontend framework (preferably React).
  • Like being part of a small team composed of UX designers, product managers, frontend/backend/full stack engineers.
  • Are excited to teach and learn from those around you.

We..

  • Are a collaborative & close-knit team: our team is Brooklyn-based and in the office because as great as technology is, there are few substitutes for in-person collaboration.
  • Take pride in our work and shares responsibility to see it through from conception to deployment to fixing bugs.
  • Can offer you top of the line equipment: your choice of hardware, standing desks, two 4K monitors, and more.
  • Offer a competitive compensation and benefits package.
  • Value honesty, transparency and respect.
  • Are excited to hear from you.
how_to_apply:
Interested? You can apply via the online application form.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

Von Ludwigshafen aus treibt unser interdisziplinäres Team die digitale Transformation europaweit an drei Standorten (Ludwigshafen, Schwarzheide und Antwerpen) voran. Dazu verwenden wir ein breites Spektrum moderner Methoden aus agiler Softwareentwicklung, Cloud Computing, IoT, Data Science und Machine Learning, wobei wir auf flache Hierarchien setzen.

  • Als hochmotivierte_r IT-Architekt_in begleiten Sie Digitalisierungsprojekte von der Ideenfindung über erste Prototypen bis hin zur Inbetriebnahme.
  • Sie unterstützen die Technologieentwicklung, begleiten den Roll-Out sowie den Betrieb digitaler Produkte.
  • Dabei bewegen Sie sich in einem fach- und einheitsübergreifenden Expertennetzwerk und kooperieren eng mit unseren Kunden in Produktion, Infrastruktur und Logistik.
  • Sie erfassen technische, operative und wirtschaftliche Anforderungen an unsere IT-Infrastruktur. Darauf aufbauend beurteilen, entwickeln und implementieren Sie zukunftsfähige Architektur für Industrie 4.0- und Digitalisierungsanwendungen.
  • Sie bringen Ihre Kreativität ein, um die Digitalisierung der BASF durch neue IT-Technologien voranzubringen.

Was wir erwarten

  • Ihr Master- oder Diplomstudium in Informatik, Nachrichten-, Elektro-, Informations- bzw. Automatisierungstechnik oder einer vergleichbaren Disziplin haben Sie überdurchschnittlich abgeschlossen.
  • Darüber hinaus haben Sie langjährige Erfahrung mit dem Entwurf, der Entwicklung und dem Betrieb komplexer heterogener IT-Systeme.
  • Sie verfügen über fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich SQL- sowie NoSQL-Datenbanken und sind sicher in Python, Java, C/C++, JavaScript oder einer vergleichbaren Programmiersprache.
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich moderner Kommunikationsprotokolle, -dienste und -technologien in den Bereichen IoT, Cloud Computing und Industrie 4.0 sind von Vorteil, ebenso wie Erfahrungen mit agilen Methoden und DevOps-Ansätzen.
  • Nicht zuletzt sind am digitalen Puls der Zeit, haben Spaß daran etwas zu bewegen und wollen greifbare Ergebnisse schaffen, die direkt bei Kunden und Partnern eingesetzt werden.

Wir bieten

  • Ein anspruchsvolles Aufgabengebiet mit hoher Eigenverantwortung. Ihre Einarbeitung erfolgt "on the job" in einem engagierten, kompetenten Team.
  • Unterstützung unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter mit unterschiedlichen Maßnahmen bei der Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben.
  • Attraktive Vergütung einschließlich betrieblicher Sozialleistungen sowie hervorragende Entwicklungschancen in einem internationalen Unternehmen.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Position Summary:

Kognition is an enterprise software company that develops an interoperability infrastructure for smart buildings and smart cities. Kognition provides an AI-powered, real-time policy engine for automated operations. We are looking for a full stack senior software engineer to join our dynamic and rapidly growing R&D team. We look at software development as a craft that requires deliberate practice, curiosity, and passion. If you work hard, have an innovative mindset, and love building great software, we should talk!

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be a key part of our research and development team that builds our core products. You will design, develop, document, test and debug software applications and services. You will work as part of a high-powered team, in an agile fashion, towards an end goal of making the world smarter, safer and more secure.

Minimum Job Qualifications:

Education/Training :

Bachelors or Masters degree; Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems, or related

Business Experience:

  • 5+ years experience in software engineering
  • Critical Skills
  • Strong application design skills and understanding of enterprise software design patterns
  • Thorough understanding and experience working with both functional and object oriented programming languages and paradigms such as Java, C++, and Rust
  • Thorough understanding and experience working with scripts and scripting languages such as (e.g. Bash, Python)
  • Experience working with containers and container orchestration systems (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, DC/OS, Nomad)
  • Experience developing highly available, highly scalable web applications
  • Experience building and integrating RESTful APIs
  • Experience with real-time pub/sub, flow, and streaming frameworks (e.g. Kafka, NiFi)
  • Experience with NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Cassandra)
  • Experience working with various testing methodologies, including test-driven development (TDD), -behavior-driven development (BDD), and unit testing
  • Experience with performance-monitoring and tuning of complex applications
  • Experience deploying, managing, and configuring applications both on-prem and in-cloud (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
  • Solid understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle in Agile environment (e.g. Kanban, Scrum)

Desired Skills:

  • Experience with machine vision (i.e. openCV)
  • Experience with web based video processing, video analytics, media compression and encoding (i.e. Gstreamer, ffmpeg)
  • Experience working with deep net frameworks (e.g. Tensorflow, Torch, mxnet, gluon)
  • Experience working with native code in non-native languages (e.g. JNA, JNI, DllImport)
  • Security industry experience

Additional Specialized Knowledge/Skills:

  • Passion for cutting-edge software design and development
  • Highly motivated and self-directed
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
  • Exceptional customer service orientation
  • Extensive experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • Willingness to mentor and train junior developers
  • Willingness to support resolution of escalated technical support issues
  • Willingness to travel to client locations is preferred

Work Location:

  • Position located in our Philadelphia, PA office (between Ivy Ridge and Manayunk).
  • WFH flexibility with a focus on in-office availability.
  • General Office, Travel less than 10%.

title: Operator Web Services (m/w/d)
description:
Fuhrparks in über 40 Ländern verlassen sich auf unsere smarten und zukunftsweisenden Mobilitätslösungen. Werden Sie Teil eines engagierten und begeisterten Teams, das die gewerbliche Mobilität von morgen europaweit mitgestaltet.

  • Administration von Java-Webanwendungen
  • Erfahrung in den Bereichen Load-Balancing, Ausfallsicherheit, Resilienz, Monitoring-Integration
  • Optimalerweise Erfahrung mit Produkten wie: Liferay, Tomcat, WildFly, Apache HTTPD, Mule ESB
  • Selbständige Arbeitsweise, Teamfähigkeit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit

Davon werden Sie profitieren

  • Freiraum für eigene Ideen,

title: Senior Frontend Developer at Ferryscanner
description:

title: Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) Java/JEE
description:
Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) Java/JEE für kundenspezifische Softwarelösungen

Standort: Frankfurt am Main, München, Nürnberg, Stuttgart, Hamburg, Düsseldorf

Start: ab sofort

Wir sind PENTASYS

Wir optimieren Geschäftsprozesse durch smarte IT-Lösungen – seit über 20 Jahren. Die Büros: Haupsitz München, weitere in Frankfurt a. M., Nürnberg, Düsseldorf, Stuttgart und Hamburg. Das Gute: Unsere Projekte werden immer vielzähliger. Und vielfältiger. Das Beste: Unsere 400 Mitarbeiter.

Unser Ziel

Viele neue Kolleginnen und Kollegen für unsere Entwickler­teams. Wir suchen Java-Entwickler für kunden­spezifische Entwicklungs­projekte. Vom Berufsanfänger bis zum Profi. Denn wir haben eine Menge Projekte zu realisieren. Freiraum? Bekommen Sie. Karriere­möglich­keiten? Haben Sie.

Ihre Aufgaben als JAVA- / JEE-Entwickler

Mit Spaß an der Arbeit herausragende Software für den Kunden entwickeln. Sie entwickeln leiden­schaftlich gerne Software und implementieren maßgeschneiderte JEE-Applikationen bei unseren Kunden. Dabei greifen Sie bspw. auf Technologien wie JSF und JPA zurück. Ihre Ergeb­nisse versionieren Sie im Team z. B. mit Git oder SVN und bauen komplette Softwarepakete mit Gradle oder Maven. Test­getriebene Entwicklung gehört für Sie ebenfalls zum guten Ton.

Unsere Projekt­vielfalt

Niemand kennt oder kann alles – Was Sie noch nicht kennen, lernen Sie bei uns. Als Teil unserer Entwicklerteams bauen Sie benutzerfreundliche Web-Applikationen durch moderne Webtechnologien wie HTML5 und CSS3 sowie JavaScript Frameworks wie Angular und React. Sie bauen REST-Schnittstellen mit Spring Boot, Spring oder Node.js und verwenden dazu Web- oder Application Server wie Apache Tomcat, Wildfly, Geronimo oder Nginx. Dabei setzen Sie Ihre Kenntnisse in der objektorientierten Programmierung ein und nutzen Entwicklungsumgebungen wie IntelliJ oder Eclipse. Die Anwendungen werden gekapselt in Docker-Container verteilt und mit Kubernetes konfiguriert. Diese Anwendungen laufen dann je nach Projektumfeld auf virtuellen Maschinen oder modernen Cloud-Plattformen wie Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure oder Cloud Foundry. Wir begleiten Sie bei Ihrem Weg zum und durch den agilen Prozess, nach SCRUM oder Kanban. Zusätzlich zu unserer Projektvielfalt haben Sie durch unsere internen und externen Workshops die Möglichkeit, sich in diesen und vielen anderen Themen kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln.

Unser Angebot: Perspektiven für Entwickler

Entwicklung: Fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung ist das A und O. Wir bieten Ihnen technologische, methodische und soziale Weiter­bildungen an. Von Profis. Für Profis. Freiheiten: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Sabbatical, individuelle Karriere­gestaltung. Finanzen: Erfolgsbeteiligung, Reise­prämie, Übernahme von Reisekosten in Vor­leistung, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, Buchbudget, „Pimp Your IT“-Budget. Umfeld: Hochqualifizierte Kollegen, moderne IT-Ausstattung und attraktive Kunden­einsätze. Community: Feste gehören zum Programm. Dazu noch interne Coding Dojos, Commities of Practice und Themenabende.

Anforderungen

(Erste) praktische Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Java/JEE basierten Softwarelösungen und den gängigen Java-Frameworks. Dazu Kenntnisse in einer oder verschiedenen Entwicklungs­umgebungen und im Umgang mit modernen Modellierungs­werkzeugen sowie gute Deutsch­kenntnisse.

Senden Sie uns Ihre Bewer­bung über unsere Karriere­welt – und wenn alles passt: Herzlich will­kom­men im Team!

Weitere Informationen über Ihre Karriere bei PENTASYS unter: karrierewelt.pentasys.de

SIE HABEN NOCH FRAGEN? Dann rufen Sie uns bitte an. Unsere HR-Abteilungen in München 089/57952-553 und Frankfurt 069/7079839-553 wissen bestens Bescheid

PENTASYS AG, Rüdesheimer Straße 9, 80686 München
